results.title: The Bribe
results.creator_credit: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ashlea Thomas, Legacy and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.description: It took the bribe of a new phone by her mother to convince Ashlea to go on a Legacy camp. As much as she missed her father, she didn’t want his death to define her. At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.

At the camp, Ashlea started to make friends and became a member of Legacy, which she has been a part of ever since.

results.title: An Interview with Norm Smithells
results.creator_credit: Norm Smithells and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.
results.description: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.
description_for_label: Norm Smithells was a Spitfire pilot in Europe during World War II. He reflects on flying and fighting the Germans during this time and shares his history as there are not many pilots left.

results.title: An Interview with Douglas Margetts
results.creator_credit: Douglas Margetts and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.
results.description: Douglas Margetts served as part of the Australian 6th Division Signals and served in the Middle East and New Guinea in World War II. He relates his experiences as part of “In our words”, a Digital Storytelling workshop for Victorian war veterans.

results.title: An Interview with Bill Saunders
results.creator_credit: Bill Saunders and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.
results.description: Bill Saunders joined the Airforce with his brother when both were called up in 1941. He shares stories from this time, about his training and posting in Europe as a pilot during World War II. In his time, he flew Tigermoths and the Ansons.

results.title: An Interview with Allan Couper
results.creator_credit: Allan Couper and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.
results.description: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.
description_for_label: Allan Couper is a Victorian World War II veteran. He served as a pilot in Europe as part of the Bomber Squadron. As part of the Digital Storytelling project “In our words”, Allan relates his experiences of fighting in Europe during the war.

results.title: An Interview with Wing Commander Peter Isaacson : Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees (1983-2000)
results.creator_credit: Peter Isaacson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: After returning from World War II, having served in the RAAF as a Pathfinder, Peter Isaacson was appointed a Shrine of Remembrance Trustee. He discusses his time at the Shrine, as Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees and the role of the Shrine in helping Australians remember as well as teaching those who don’t remember the history of Australia at war.
results.title_for_label: An Interview with Wing Commander Peter Isaacson : Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees (1983-2000)
results.description: After returning from World War II, having served in the RAAF as a Pathfinder, Peter Isaacson was appointed a Shrine of Remembrance Trustee. He discusses his time at the Shrine, as Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees and the role of the Shrine in helping Australians remember as well as teaching those who don’t remember the history of Australia at war.
description_for_label: After returning from World War II, having served in the RAAF as a Pathfinder, Peter Isaacson was appointed a Shrine of Remembrance Trustee. He discusses his time at the Shrine, as Chairman of the Shrine of Remembrance Trustees and the role of the Shrine in helping Australians remember as well as teaching those who don’t remember the history of Australia at war.

results.title: An Interview with Jock McAuley
results.creator_credit: Jock McAuley and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Jock McAuley remembers hearing Prime Minister Menzies announcing Australia was at war. He was only 15 or 16 at the time and wondered if the would be still going by the time he was old enough to join. Against his dad’s wishes, Jock joined up and served as a pilot during the war. He tells of his experiences fighting for Australia.
results.description: Jock McAuley remembers hearing Prime Minister Menzies announcing Australia was at war. He was only 15 or 16 at the time and wondered if the would be still going by the time he was old enough to join. Against his dad’s wishes, Jock joined up and served as a pilot during the war. He tells of his experiences fighting for Australia.
description_for_label: Jock McAuley remembers hearing Prime Minister Menzies announcing Australia was at war. He was only 15 or 16 at the time and wondered if the would be still going by the time he was old enough to join. Against his dad’s wishes, Jock joined up and served as a pilot during the war. He tells of his experiences fighting for Australia.

results.title: An Interview with Peter Isaacson : pathfinder
results.creator_credit: Peter Isaacson and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Peter Isaacson tells his story of joining the Air Force in World War II and becoming part of the legendary Pathfinders. Peter also became famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II.
results.description: Peter Isaacson tells his story of joining the Air Force in World War II and becoming part of the legendary Pathfinders. Peter also became famous for flying under the Sydney Harbour Bridge towards the end of World War II.

results.title: My naval experiences : World War II
results.creator_credit: Tom Clark and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Tom Clark recalls the declaration of war against Germany by Prime Minister Menzies. He then shares his experiences of enlisting in the Navy in 1942 as a mid shipman, his time on the HMAS Kanimbla and fighting the Japanese in the Pacific
results.description: Tom Clark recalls the declaration of war against Germany by Prime Minister Menzies. He then shares his experiences of enlisting in the Navy in 1942 as a mid shipman, his time on the HMAS Kanimbla and fighting the Japanese in the Pacific
description_for_label: Tom Clark recalls the declaration of war against Germany by Prime Minister Menzies. He then shares his experiences of enlisting in the Navy in 1942 as a mid shipman, his time on the HMAS Kanimbla and fighting the Japanese in the Pacific

results.title: My life in the war years = My life during the war years
results.creator_credit: May Donovan and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: May Donovan was a young woman when World War II broke out. She speaks about her life in Melbourne and how she was affected by the war, despite being so far away. She is a member of the Victorian War Widows Guild and created this digital story in memory of Pat Medaris.
results.title_for_label: My life in the war years = My life during the war years
results.description: May Donovan was a young woman when World War II broke out. She speaks about her life in Melbourne and how she was affected by the war, despite being so far away. She is a member of the Victorian War Widows Guild and created this digital story in memory of Pat Medaris.
description_for_label: May Donovan was a young woman when World War II broke out. She speaks about her life in Melbourne and how she was affected by the war, despite being so far away. She is a member of the Victorian War Widows Guild and created this digital story in memory of Pat Medaris.
